content: quote: The retailer said that the stores were in “strongly Hispanic neighbourhoods” and would feature a “new lay-out, signing and product assortment designed to make them even more relevant to local Hispanic customers”. The staff will also be bilingual. Sounds like WalMart is practicing racial profiling by marketing these stores in these neighborhoods. Just because someone lives in a strongly hispanic neighborhood doesn't mean they speak spanish or want more of a selection of latin goods. I hope the Justice Department is ready to investigate and then prosecute them to the fullest extent that the law allows.
quote: The retailer said that the stores were in “strongly Hispanic neighbourhoods” and would feature a “new lay-out, signing and product assortment designed to make them even more relevant to local Hispanic customers”. The staff will also be bilingual.

title: All American WalMart Strikes Again..Wal-Mart looks to Hispanic market

content: I guess this means crackerjack will be boycotting Best Buy and Home Depot too. Even if it's only because of their online stores the story mentioned: "Leading retailers are also pursuing Hispanic consumers online, with Best Buy and Home Depot having launched Spanish-language versions of their e-commerce sites in recent months." I'm not entirely sold on the need for an "official" language. Particularly on the national level. Call it a states rights issue. By the way, states such as Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, California and others were once part of Mexico. Should Spanish be the "unofficial" language of these states?
reply: I guess this means crackerjack will be boycotting Best Buy and Home Depot too. content: quote: Originally posted by athos20: How exactly is Wal-Mart screwing this country by offering goods and services? The story also cites other companies doing the same thing but you didn't seem to be upset with them. Any reason why? Wow! "The markets include elements such as cafés serving Latino pastries and coffee, and full service meat and fish counters." "A 195,000 sq ft Supercenter that opened in Texas last year included a tortilleria bakery, Hispanic foods and a larger selection of Spanish-language music and DVDs." Sounds like this will be a "hit" with more than just the local community. Sounds like a good marketing plan. Also.....you do know that even in public schools we have to be able to provide services for other language speakers...dual signs (Spanish-English), communication from the school, forms, etc. I noticed that even some newspapers now have sections specific to the Latino community (and these articles are not also provided for the English-only speaker). "They love our milk and honey but they preach about some other way of living When you’re running down my country, Hoss you’re walking on the fighting side of me" - - Merle Haggard
quote: Originally posted by athos20: How exactly is Wal-Mart screwing this country by offering goods and services? The story also cites other companies doing the same thing but you didn't seem to be upset with them. Any reason why?
reply: Wow! "The markets include elements such as cafés serving Latino pastries and coffee, and full service meat and fish counters." "A 195,000 sq ft Supercenter that opened in Texas last year included a tortilleria bakery, Hispanic foods and a larger selection of Spanish-language music and DVDs." Sounds like this will be a "hit" with more than just the local community. Sounds like a good marketing plan. Also.....you do know that even in public schools we have to be able to provide services for other language speakers...dual signs (Spanish-English), communication from the school, forms, etc. I noticed that even some newspapers now have sections specific to the Latino community (and these articles are not also provided for the English-only speaker). "They love our milk and honey but they preach about some other way of living When you’re running down my country, Hoss you’re walking on the fighting side of me" - - Merle Haggard

title: All American WalMart Strikes Again..Wal-Mart looks to Hispanic market

content: If you are getting shoddy goods at Wal-Mart you can blame Wal-Mart for this happening. In the beginning when a company wants to do business with Wal-Mart they offer their product at a price and with minor haggling Wal-Mart purchases thousands and thousands of units. In some cases they buy almost the entire output of the supplier. After a few years of this Wal-Mart starts lowering the amount they will pay and since the supplier has no one else to sell such volume to they lower the price. Each year the prices are negotiated lower and lower until the manufacturer simply is not making a profit. Here is where the product suffers. You can buy an item at Wal-Mart in the same box with the same numbers and it will be nothing but a cheap piece of junk or you can by the original product from another store at a reasonable price and get a good product. Wall-Mart knows this but yet continues these practices and continues to sell the junk. This is a great example of you get what you pay for! This message has been edited. Last edited by: Another4Truth, Sat 14 March 2009 04:59 PM

"The markets include elements such as cafés serving Latino pastries and coffee, and full service meat and fish counters." "A 195,000 sq ft Supercenter that opened in Texas last year included a tortilleria bakery, Hispanic foods and a larger selection of Spanish-language music and DVDs." Sounds like this will be a "hit" with more than just the local community. Sounds like a good marketing plan. Also.....you do know that even in public schools we have to be able to provide services for other language speakers...dual signs (Spanish-English), communication from the school, forms, etc. I noticed that even some newspapers now have sections specific to the Latino community (and these articles are not also provided for the English-only speaker). "They love our milk and honey but they preach about some other way of living When you’re running down my country, Hoss you’re walking on the fighting side of me" - - Merle Haggard
quote: Originally posted by athos20: How exactly is Wal-Mart screwing this country by offering goods and services? The story also cites other companies doing the same thing but you didn't seem to be upset with them. Any reason why?

"A 195,000 sq ft Supercenter that opened in Texas last year included a tortilleria bakery, Hispanic foods and a larger selection of Spanish-language music and DVDs." Sounds like this will be a "hit" with more than just the local community. Sounds like a good marketing plan. Also.....you do know that even in public schools we have to be able to provide services for other language speakers...dual signs (Spanish-English), communication from the school, forms, etc. I noticed that even some newspapers now have sections specific to the Latino community (and these articles are not also provided for the English-only speaker). "They love our milk and honey but they preach about some other way of living When you’re running down my country, Hoss you’re walking on the fighting side of me" - - Merle Haggard

title: All American WalMart Strikes Again..Wal-Mart looks to Hispanic market

content: If you are getting shoddy goods at Wal-Mart you can blame Wal-Mart for this happening. In the beginning when a company wants to do business with Wal-Mart they offer their product at a price and with minor haggling Wal-Mart purchases thousands and thousands of units. In some cases they buy almost the entire output of the supplier. After a few years of this Wal-Mart starts lowering the amount they will pay and since the supplier has no one else to sell such volume to they lower the price. Each year the prices are negotiated lower and lower until the manufacturer simply is not making a profit. Here is where the product suffers. You can buy an item at Wal-Mart in the same box with the same numbers and it will be nothing but a cheap piece of junk or you can by the original product from another store at a reasonable price and get a good product. Wall-Mart knows this but yet continues these practices and continues to sell the junk. This is a great example of you get what you pay for! This message has been edited. Last edited by: Another4Truth, Sat 14 March 2009 04:59 PM

content: quote: The retailer said that the stores were in “strongly Hispanic neighbourhoods” and would feature a “new lay-out, signing and product assortment designed to make them even more relevant to local Hispanic customers”. The staff will also be bilingual. Sounds like WalMart is practicing racial profiling by marketing these stores in these neighborhoods. Just because someone lives in a strongly hispanic neighborhood doesn't mean they speak spanish or want more of a selection of latin goods. I hope the Justice Department is ready to investigate and then prosecute them to the fullest extent that the law allows.
quote: The retailer said that the stores were in “strongly Hispanic neighbourhoods” and would feature a “new lay-out, signing and product assortment designed to make them even more relevant to local Hispanic customers”. The staff will also be bilingual.

title: All American WalMart Strikes Again..Wal-Mart looks to Hispanic market

content: I guess this means crackerjack will be boycotting Best Buy and Home Depot too. Even if it's only because of their online stores the story mentioned: "Leading retailers are also pursuing Hispanic consumers online, with Best Buy and Home Depot having launched Spanish-language versions of their e-commerce sites in recent months." I'm not entirely sold on the need for an "official" language. Particularly on the national level. Call it a states rights issue. By the way, states such as Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, California and others were once part of Mexico. Should Spanish be the "unofficial" language of these states?
reply: I guess this means crackerjack will be boycotting Best Buy and Home Depot too. Even if it's only because of their online stores the story mentioned: "Leading retailers are also pursuing Hispanic consumers online, with Best Buy and Home Depot having launched Spanish-language versions of their e-commerce sites in recent months." content: If you are getting shoddy goods at Wal-Mart you can blame Wal-Mart for this happening. In the beginning when a company wants to do business with Wal-Mart they offer their product at a price and with minor haggling Wal-Mart purchases thousands and thousands of units. In some cases they buy almost the entire output of the supplier. After a few years of this Wal-Mart starts lowering the amount they will pay and since the supplier has no one else to sell such volume to they lower the price. Each year the prices are negotiated lower and lower until the manufacturer simply is not making a profit. Here is where the product suffers. You can buy an item at Wal-Mart in the same box with the same numbers and it will be nothing but a cheap piece of junk or you can by the original product from another store at a reasonable price and get a good product. Wall-Mart knows this but yet continues these practices and continues to sell the junk. This is a great example of you get what you pay for! This message has been edited. Last edited by: Another4Truth, Sat 14 March 2009 04:59 PM

Best prices, best selection of clothes, full grocery store, lawn and garden, hardware, sporting, auto center, etc. All at a reasonable price! The ones in the Miami area suck due mostly to the dirtbags they hire.
